snippet: Meg Whitman announced that Hewlett-Packard would retain its PC division, citing “a lot of opportunity.”
abstract: Hewlett-Packard chief executive Meg Whitman announces company will retain its PC hardware division, which former chief Leo Apotheker had considered selling.

headline.main: In a Switch, H.P. Chief Will Keep the PC Group
headline.print_headline: In a Switch, H.P. Chief Will Keep the PC Group

snippet: With senior employees rushing for the exits, the embattled online media company is eager to sign a deal and calm its ranks.

snippet: Research in Motion said the new operating system, intended to correct such omissions as the inability to send email without being linked to a phone, won’t be ready until next year.
abstract: Research in Motion delays release of improved operating system for its Blackberry Playbook tablet, sinking chances of higher holiday sales for product.

headline.main: RIM Delays Software Update for Its BlackBerry PlayBook
headline.print_headline: RIM Delays Software Update For Its BlackBerry PlayBook

snippet: The independent investment bank's core mergers advisory unit showed a strong gain in revenue, but its business of advising on stock offerings and private equity fund-raising slowed considerably.
